member.name: T:cAlgo.API.CloudAttribute
member.summary: Represents the cloud between the indicator lines.

member.name: M:cAlgo.API.CloudAttribute.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: The cloud between the indicator lines.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.CloudAttribute.FirstLineName
member.summary: The name of the first indicator line.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.CloudAttribute.SecondLineName
member.summary: The name of the second indicator line.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.CloudAttribute.Opacity
member.summary: The cloud opacity. Value can be set from 0 (transparent) to 1 (opaque). Values higher than 1 will be set to 1, values below 0 will be set to 0. Opacity is multiplied by the alpha channel of the active color (first or second color). Default opacity value is 0.2.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.CloudAttribute.FirstColor
member.summary: Cloud color when the first line is above the second one. If not specified, the color of the first line is used.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.CloudAttribute.SecondColor
member.summary: Cloud color when the second line is above the first one. If not specified, color of the second line is used.

member.name: T:cAlgo.API.IndicatorAttribute
member.summary: Indicator Attribute. Applies metadata to enable the indicator plot.
member.remarks: To make it effective apply enclosed in square brackets, e.g. [Indicator] before the indicator class declaration. Cannot be omitted.

example.code: [Indicator(ScalePrecision = 5, IsOverlay = false, TimeZone = TimeZones.UTC)] public class SampleIndicator : Indicator

member.name: M:cAlgo.API.IndicatorAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the IndicatorAttribute
member.remarks: To make it effective apply enclosed in square brackets, e.g. [Indicator] before the indicator class declaration. The name is displayed on the top left of the indicator panel.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.IndicatorAttribute.Name
member.summary: The name of the Indicator.
member.remarks: The name is displayed to the left of the indicator panel.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.IndicatorAttribute.ScalePrecision
member.summary: The price scale precision.
member.remarks: The number of decimals displayed on the price scale of the indicator panel

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.IndicatorAttribute.IsOverlay
member.summary: Indicates whether this instance is overlayed on the chart or plotted on a separate indicator panel
member.value: The IsOverlay property sets the value true if this Indicator should be plotted on the chart panel; false if the indicator should be plotted on a separate Indicator Panel

example.code: [Indicator(IsOverlay = true)] // Plots the Indicator on the chart public class SampleIndicator : Indicator
[Indicator(IsOverlay = false)] // Plots the Indicator on a separate indicator panel. public class SampleIndicator : Indicator

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.IndicatorAttribute.AutoRescale
member.summary: Indicates whether this instance automatically rescales the chart or not. Default value is true.

example.code: [Indicator(AutoRescale = false)] public class SampleIndicator : Indicator

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.IndicatorAttribute.TimeZone
member.summary: Gets or sets the chart timezone of the displayed indicator.

example.code: [Indicator(TimeZone = TimeZones.UTC)] public class SampleIndicator : Indicator

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.IndicatorAttribute.AccessRights
member.summary: Gets or sets the access rights required for Indicator.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.IndicatorAttribute.IsPercentage
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the indicator is a percentage indicator. If one or more percentage indicators are added to the same panel, they will share the same scale. The default value is false.

example.code: [Indicator(IsPercentage = true)] public class SamplePercentageIndicator : Indicator

member.name: T:cAlgo.API.LevelsAttribute
member.summary: Levels Attribute. Applies metadata to enable the plot of level lines.
member.remarks: Represents level lines. It is commonly used in Oscillators, for instance to add a zero line. Must be added before the indicator class declaration.

member.name: M:cAlgo.API.LevelsAttribute.#ctor(System.Double[])
member.summary: Initializes a new LevelsAttribute instance
member.remarks: Draws level (horizontal) lines at a fixed position when the plot is on the indicator panel below the chart. To make it effective apply enclosed in square brackets, e.g. [Levels(0)], before the Indicator atribute declaration.
member.param: The price values that the level lines are representing

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.LevelsAttribute.Levels
member.summary: The array of price values that are ploted as level lines

member.name: T:cAlgo.API.OutputAttribute
member.summary: Sealed Class OutputAttribute
member.remarks: Marks a IndicatorDataSeries property as output to be displayed on the chart or panel below. To make it effective please apply this attribute in front of the declaration of the IndicatorDataSeries to be displayed.

member.name: M:cAlgo.API.OutputAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the OutputAttribute and sets the name.
member.param: The name given to the output plot

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.OutputAttribute.LineStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the Line Style for given Output property. By default it is set to Solid
member.remarks: If PlotType = PlotType.Line (default) the LineStyle can be added. Supported line styles are: Dots DotsRare DotsVeryRare Lines LinesDots Solid

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.OutputAttribute.Name
member.summary: The plot name
member.remarks: Displayed in the User Interface when adding an new instance of the Indicator.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.OutputAttribute.LineColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the Color of the Output property. This Color will be used when the line for this Output is plotted.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.OutputAttribute.Thickness
member.summary: Sets the Width of the Output property.
member.remarks: This Width will be used when the line for this Output is plotted.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.OutputAttribute.PlotType
member.summary: Plot type.
member.remarks: The type of the output plotted on the output panel. Default = Line Supported types are: Line Points Histogram

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.OutputAttribute.IsColorCustomizable
member.summary: Sets if Output line color is customizable or not.
member.remarks: This property is useful when you are setting line color manually with code via SetLineAppearance method.

member.name: T:cAlgo.API.ParameterAttribute
member.summary: The Parameter Attribute class.
member.remarks: Marks a property as input parameter.

member.name: M:cAlgo.API.ParameterAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new ParameterAttribute instance and sets the name.
member.remarks: Represents an input parameter to the program. To make it effective type in enclosed in square brackets, e.g. [Parameter], before the property declaration. Parameters are listed in the instance button of the robot/indicator.

member.name: M:cAlgo.API.ParameterAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ParameterAttribute class.
member.remarks: In this case the parameter name is the same as the property name.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.ParameterAttribute.DefaultValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the default value of this Parameter property.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.ParameterAttribute.MinValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum value of this Parameter property. It is used for validating user input.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.ParameterAttribute.MaxValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum value of this Parameter property. It is used for validating user input.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.ParameterAttribute.Step
member.summary: Gets or sets the step of this Parameter. Step is used in NumericUpDown controls in parameter editors.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.ParameterAttribute.Group
member.summary: Groups parameters in UI.

member.name: T:cAlgo.API.PluginAttribute
member.summary: Sealed class PluginAttribute.
member.remarks: Marks a class as a Plugin. The Plugin attribute cannot be omitted.

member.name: M:cAlgo.API.PluginAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new PluginAttribute instance.
member.remarks: To make it effective apply enclosed in square brackets, e.g. [Plugin], in front of the Plugin class declaration.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.PluginAttribute.TimeZone
member.summary: Sets the timezone for all the Plugin datetime references
member.remarks: All dates and times within the Plugin will be converted to this timezone

example.code: [Plugin(TimeZone = TimeZones.EasternStandardTime)] public class NewPlugin : Plugin

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.PluginAttribute.AccessRights
member.summary: Gets or sets the access rights required for the Plugin.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether indicators created by robot will be added to chart or not.
member.remarks: Default value is false.

member.name: F:cAlgo.API.ChartObjectType.HorizontalLine
member.summary: The horizontal line. The line parallel to the X-axis that can be set on any Y-axis value.

member.summary: The vertical line. The line parallel to the Y-axis that can be set on any X-axis value. used to mark certain time event or chart bar on the chart.TBD

member.summary: The trend line. The line with the start and end points that can be drawn in any direction on the chart.

member.summary: The text that can be placed directly in the chart, bound to X-Y axises.

member.summary: The static positioned text that can be placed on fixed locations in the chart

member.summary: The icon. The collection of icons that can be placed directly in the chart, bound to X-Y axises.

member.name: F:cAlgo.API.ChartObjectType.FibonacciRetracement
member.summary: The Fibonacci Retracement that can be placed directly in the chart, bound to X-Y axises. - a charting technique that uses the Fibonacci ratios to indicate the areas of support or resistance.

member.name: F:cAlgo.API.ChartObjectType.FibonacciExpansion
member.summary: The Fibonacci Expansion that can be placed directly in the chart, bound to X-Y axises. - a charting technique used to plot possible levels of support and resistance by tracking not only the primary trend but also the retracement.

member.name: F:cAlgo.API.ChartObjectType.FibonacciFan
member.summary: The Fibonacci Fan that can be placed directly in the chart, bound to X-Y axises. a charting technique used to estimate support and resistance levels by drawing the new trend lines based on the Fibonacci Retracement levels.

member.param: Base color from which red, green and blue values will be copied to a new color

example.code: var transparentBlue = Color.FromArgb(128, Color.Blue);

signature.code: public static Color FromArgb(int alpha, Color baseColor)

member.name: M:cAlgo.API.Color.FromArgb(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a color from a 32-bit ARGB value.

member.name: M:cAlgo.API.Color.FromArgb(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a color from red, green and blue values. The alpha value is implicitly 255 (fully opaque).

example.code: var greenColor = Color.FromArgb(0, 255, 0);

signature.code: public static Color FromArgb(int red, int green, int blue)

member.name: M:cAlgo.API.Color.FromHex(System.String)
member.summary: Attempts to convert a hex string to a Color.
member.param: Hex string to convert to a Color

example.code: var color = Color.FromHex("#808080");

member.returns: A Color that represents the converted hex string.

member.name: M:cAlgo.API.Color.FromName(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a color from the specified name of a predefined color.

example.code: var greenColor = Color.FromName("Green");

member.returns: A Color for specified name or color with value #00000000 if the name was not found.

member.name: F:cAlgo.API.Color.Empty
member.summary: Represents empty color.

member.name: T:cAlgo.API.IndicatorArea
member.summary: Represents the area where the Indicator is placed.

member.name: T:cAlgo.API.ChartIndicator
member.summary: The interface representing an indicator attached to a chart. Provides properties that allow for accessing various information about an indicator.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.ChartIndicator.Name
member.summary: Gets the name of an indicator.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.ChartIndicator.InstanceId
member.summary: Gets the ID of a specific indicator instance.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.ChartIndicator.PanelIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the index of the panel on which an indicator is displayed.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.ChartIndicator.Type
member.summary: Gets the IndicatorType of an indicator.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.ChartIndicator.Parameters
member.summary: Gets the collection of indicator parameters.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.ChartIndicator.Lines
member.summary: Gets the IReadonlyList of indicator output lines.

member.name: T:cAlgo.API.ChartIndicators
member.summary: The interface representing a chart indicator instances collection. Provides properties and events that allow for accessing various information about indicators attached to a chart.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.ChartIndicators.Item(System.String)
member.summary: Gets an indicator attached to a chart by its instance ID.
member.param: The instance ID of an indicator attached to a chart.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.ChartIndicators.Count
member.summary: Gets the number of all indicators attached to a chart.

member.name: M:cAlgo.API.ChartIndicators.Add(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Adds a new indicator to a chart.
member.returns: An ChartIndicator representing the added indicator instance.

signature.code: public ChartIndicator Add(string name, object[] parameterValues)

member.name: M:cAlgo.API.ChartIndicators.Remove(cAlgo.API.ChartIndicator)
member.summary: Removes an indicator from a chart.
member.param: The ChartIndicator to be removed from a chart.
member.returns: True if remove was successful otherwise false.

member.name: E:cAlgo.API.ChartIndicators.IndicatorAdded
member.summary: Occurs when a new indicator is added to a chart.

member.name: E:cAlgo.API.ChartIndicators.IndicatorRemoved
member.summary: Occurs when an indicator is removed from a chart.

member.name: E:cAlgo.API.ChartIndicators.IndicatorModified
member.summary: Occurs when an indicator attached to a chart is modified.

member.summary: A ScrollBar appears and the dimension of the ScrollViewer is applied to the content when the viewport cannot display all of the content.

member.summary: Represents the ellipse shape.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:cAlgo.API.FillRule
member.summary: Specifies how the intersecting areas of PathFigure objects contained in a Geometry are combined to form the area of the Geometry.

member.name: F:cAlgo.API.FillRule.EvenOdd
member.summary: Rule that determines whether a point is in the fill region by drawing a ray from that point to infinity in any direction and counting the number of path segments within the given shape that the ray crosses. If this number is odd, the point is inside; if even, the point is outside.

member.name: F:cAlgo.API.FillRule.Nonzero
member.summary: Rule that determines whether a point is in the fill region of the path by drawing a ray from that point to infinity in any direction and then examining the places where a segment of the shape crosses the ray. Starting with a count of zero, add one each time a segment crosses the ray from left to right and subtract one each time a path segment crosses the ray from right to left. After counting the crossings, if the result is zero then the point is outside the path. Otherwise, it is inside.

member.name: T:cAlgo.API.Stretch
member.summary: Describes how content is resized to fill its allocated space.

member.name: F:cAlgo.API.Stretch.None
member.summary: The content preserves its original size.

member.name: F:cAlgo.API.Stretch.Fill
member.summary: The content is resized to fill the destination dimensions. The aspect ratio is not preserved.

member.name: F:cAlgo.API.Stretch.Uniform
member.summary: The content is resized to fit in the destination dimensions while it preserves its native aspect ratio.

member.name: F:cAlgo.API.Stretch.UniformToFill
member.summary: The content is resized to fill the destination dimensions while it preserves its native aspect ratio. If the aspect ratio of the destination rectangle differs from the source, the source content is clipped to fit in the destination dimensions.

member.name: T:cAlgo.API.StretchDirection
member.summary: Describes how scaling applies to content and restricts scaling to named axis types.

member.name: F:cAlgo.API.StretchDirection.UpOnly
member.summary: The content scales upward only when it is smaller than the parent. If the content is larger, no scaling downward is performed.

member.name: F:cAlgo.API.StretchDirection.DownOnly
member.summary: The content scales downward only when it is larger than the parent. If the content is smaller, no scaling upward is performed.

member.name: F:cAlgo.API.StretchDirection.Both
member.summary: The content stretches to fit the parent according to the Stretch mode.

member.name: T:cAlgo.API.TextTrimming
member.summary: Describes how text is trimmed when it overflows the edge of its containing box.

member.name: F:cAlgo.API.TextTrimming.None
member.summary: Text is not trimmed.

member.name: F:cAlgo.API.TextTrimming.CharacterEllipsis
member.summary: Text is trimmed at a character boundary. An ellipsis (...) is drawn in place of remaining text.

member.name: F:cAlgo.API.TextTrimming.WordEllipsis
member.summary: Text is trimmed at a word boundary. An ellipsis (...) is drawn in place of remaining text.

member.name: T:cAlgo.API.TextWrapping
member.summary: Specifies whether text wraps when it reaches the edge of the containing box.

member.name: F:cAlgo.API.TextWrapping.WrapWithOverflow
member.summary: Line-breaking occurs if the line overflows beyond the available block width. However, a line may overflow beyond the block width if the line breaking algorithm cannot determine a line break opportunity, as in the case of a very long word constrained in a fixed-width container with no scrolling allowed.

member.name: F:cAlgo.API.TextWrapping.NoWrap
member.summary: No line wrapping is performed.

member.name: F:cAlgo.API.TextWrapping.Wrap
member.summary: Line-breaking occurs if the line overflows beyond the available block width, even if the standard line breaking algorithm cannot determine any line break opportunity, as in the case of a very long word constrained in a fixed-width container with no scrolling allowed.

member.name: T:cAlgo.API.DataSeries
member.summary: Represents a read only list of values, typically used to represent market price series. The values are accessed with an array-like [] operator.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.DataSeries.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the value in the dataseries at the specified position.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.DataSeries.LastValue
member.summary: Gets the last value of this DataSeries.
member.remarks: The last value may represent one of the values of the last bar of the market series, e.g. Open, High, Low and Close. Therefore, take into consideration that on each tick, except the Open price, the rest of the values will most probably change.

member.name: M:cAlgo.API.DataSeries.Last(System.Int32)
member.summary: Access a value in the dataseries certain bars ago

example.code: double value = MarketSeries.Close.Last(5); Print("The close price 5 bars ago was: {0}", value);
double currentClose = MarketSeries.Close.Last(0); Print("Current Close: {0}", currentClose);

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.DataSeries.Count
member.summary: Gets the total number of elements contained in the DataSeries.

member.summary: This class contains valuable functions that apply to DataSeries.

member.summary: Checks if the last value in a dataseries is greater than the previous.
member.returns: True if the last value of a dataseries is greater than the previous, false otherwise

member.summary: Checks if the last value in a dataseries is less than the previous
member.returns: True if the last value in a dataseries is less than the previous, false otherwise

member.name: M:cAlgo.API.Functions.Maximum(cAlgo.API.DataSeries,System.Int32)
member.summary: Finds the maximum value in a dataseries for a given period.
member.returns: The maximum value in the dataseries in this period

example.code: var maxHigh = MarketSeries.High.Maximum(periods);

signature.code: public static double Maximum(DataSeries series, int period)

member.name: M:cAlgo.API.Functions.Minimum(cAlgo.API.DataSeries,System.Int32)
member.summary: Finds the minimum of a dataseries for a given period.
member.returns: The minimum value in the dataseries in this period

example.code: var minLow = MarketSeries.Low.Minimum(periods);

signature.code: public static double Minimum(DataSeries series, int period)

member.name: M:cAlgo.API.Functions.HasCrossedAbove(cAlgo.API.DataSeries,cAlgo.API.DataSeries,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns true, if dataseries1 has crossed above dataseries2, over the specified Period.
member.param: Period for which to check for crossing
member.remarks:
HasCrossedAbove will compare the crossing dataseries to the crossed dataseries starting from the current value of the series going back the specified period. If period is zero only the current bar values will be compared. If period is one the current bar values will be compared as well as the previous.
e.g. Functions.HasCrossedAbove(sma.Result, MarketSeries.Close, 0) will only compare the current values which are not completed until the close of the bar. It is not uncommon that the function will return true and by the end of the bar the two series will uncross.

signature.code: public static bool HasCrossedAbove(DataSeries crossingSeries, DataSeries crossedSeries, int period)

member.name: M:cAlgo.API.Functions.HasCrossedBelow(cAlgo.API.DataSeries,cAlgo.API.DataSeries,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns true, if dataseries1 has crossed below dataseries2, over the specified Period.
member.param: Period for which to check for crossing
member.remarks:
HasCrossedBelow will compare the crossing dataseries to the crossed dataseries starting from the current value of the series going back the specified period. If period is zero only the current bar values will be compared. If period is one the current bar values will be compared as well as the previous.
e.g. Functions.HasCrossedBelow(sma.Result, MarketSeries.Close, 0) will only compare the current values which are not completed until the close of the bar. It is not uncommon that the function will return true and by the end of the bar the two series will uncross.

signature.code: public static bool HasCrossedBelow(DataSeries crossingSeries, DataSeries crossedSeries, int period)

member.name: M:cAlgo.API.Functions.HasCrossedAbove(cAlgo.API.DataSeries,System.Double,System.Int32)
member.summary: Checks if dataseries1 has crossed above value, sometime within the specified period.
member.param: Price value to check if crossed
Period for which to check for crossing
member.returns: true, if dataseries1 has crossed above value
member.remarks: HasCrossedAbove will compare the crossing dataseries to the crossed dataseries starting from the current value of the series going back the specified period. If period is zero only the current bar values will be compared. If period is one the current bar values will be compared as well as the previous. e.g. Functions.HasCrossedAbove(sma.Result, value, 0) will only compare the current simple moving average series value which is not completed until the close of the bar. It is not uncommon that the function will return true and by the end of the bar the series will uncross.

signature.code: public static bool HasCrossedAbove(DataSeries crossingSeries, double value, int period)

member.name: M:cAlgo.API.Functions.HasCrossedBelow(cAlgo.API.DataSeries,System.Double,System.Int32)
member.summary: Checks if dataseries1 has crossed below the value, sometime within the specified period.
member.param: Price value to check if crossed
Period for which to check for crossing
member.returns: True if dataseries1 has crossed below value, false otherwise
member.remarks: HasCrossedBelow compares the crossing dataseries to the value starting from the current value of the series going back the specified period. If period is zero, only the current bar value will be examined. If period is one, the current and previous bar value will be examined. e.g. Functions.HasCrossedAbove(sma.Result, value, 0) will only compare the current simple moving average series value which is not completed until the close of the bar. It is not uncommon that the function will return true and by the end of the bar the series will uncross.

signature.code: public static bool HasCrossedBelow(DataSeries crossingSeries, double value, int period)

member.name: M:cAlgo.API.Functions.Sum(cAlgo.API.DataSeries,System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculates the sum of a dataseries, over the specified period.
member.param: DataSeries of which values are summed
Period of values that are summed prior to current index
member.returns: The sum of the series for the period

signature.code: public static double Sum(DataSeries series, int period)

member.summary: Identifies possible trend reversals

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Indicators.AcceleratorOscillator.Result
member.summary: AcceleratorOscillator calculation result

member.name: T:cAlgo.API.Indicators.AccumulativeSwingIndex
member.summary: A variation on Wilder's swing index which plots an accumulation of the swing index value of each candlestick or bar.
member.remarks: The accumulative swing index is used to gain a longer-term picture than the Wilder's swing index. When the accumulative swing index is positive, the long-term trend is up. When the accumulative swing index is negative, it signals a downwards long-term trend.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Indicators.AccumulativeSwingIndex.Result
member.summary: The time series of AccumulativeSwingIndex.

member.name: T:cAlgo.API.Indicators.Alligator
member.summary: Legendary trader Bill Williams, an early pioneer of market psychology, developed the trend-following Alligator indicator, which follows the premise that financial markets and individual securities trend just 15% to 30% of the time while grinding through sideways ranges the other 70% to 85% of the time.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Indicators.Alligator.Jaws
member.summary: The jaw is the x-period (13) smoothed moving average that is moved into the future by x (18) bars.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Indicators.Alligator.Teeth
member.summary: The teeth is the x-period (8) smoothed moving average that is moved x (5) bars into the future.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Indicators.Alligator.Lips
member.summary: The lips is the x-period (5) smoothed moving average that is moved by x (3) bars into the future

member.name: T:cAlgo.API.Indicators.Aroon
member.summary: An indicator for identifying trends in a currency pair, as well as for gauging the probability of a trend reversal.
member.remarks: The indicator fluctuates between 0 and 100, with values above 80 signalling an upward trend, and values below 20 signalling a downward trend.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Indicators.Aroon.Up
member.summary: Aroon Up

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Indicators.Aroon.Down
member.summary: Aroon Down

member.name: T:cAlgo.API.Indicators.AverageDirectionalMovementIndexRating
member.summary: The Average Directional Movement Index Rating (ADXR) measures the strength of the Average Directional Movement Index (ADX). It's calculated by taking the average of the current ADX and the ADX from one time period before.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Indicators.AverageDirectionalMovementIndexRating.ADX
member.summary: The Average Directional Movement Index (ADX) indicates whether the market is trending or ranging.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Indicators.AverageDirectionalMovementIndexRating.ADXR
member.summary: The rating of Average Directional Movement Index (ADX)

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Indicators.AverageDirectionalMovementIndexRating.DIMinus
member.summary: The Positive Direction Indicator (+DI) indicates upward trend movement.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Indicators.AverageDirectionalMovementIndexRating.DIPlus
member.summary: The Negative Direction Indicator (-DI) indicates downward trend movement.

member.name: T:cAlgo.API.Indicators.AverageTrueRange
member.summary: Average true range. An indicator providing the degree of price volatility.
member.remarks: Average true range is a volatility indicator originally developed by J. Welles Wilder. The indicator provides the degree of price volatility. The average true range is an N-day (exponential) moving average of the true range values. Wilder recommended a 14-period smoothing.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Indicators.AverageTrueRange.Result
member.summary: The resulting data series of Average True Range Indicator instance

member.name: T:cAlgo.API.Indicators.AwesomeOscillator
member.summary: Displays the market momentum as a histogram.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Indicators.AwesomeOscillator.Result
member.summary: Gets the Awesome Oscillator calculation result.

member.name: T:cAlgo.API.Indicators.BollingerBands
member.summary: Bollinger Bands are used to confirm signals. The bands indicate overbought and oversold levels relative to a moving average.
member.remarks: Bollinger bands widen in volatile market periods, and contract during less volatile periods. Tightening of the bands is often used a signal that there will shortly be a sharp increase in market volatility.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Indicators.BollingerBands.Main
member.summary: Moving Average (Middle Bollinger Band).

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Indicators.BollingerBands.Top
member.summary: Upper Bollinger Band.

member.name: T:cAlgo.API.Indicators.DirectionalMovementSystem
member.summary: The Welles Wilder's Directional Movement Indicator calculation.
member.remarks: Welles Wilder's Directional Movement System uses three indicators to determine whether the market is trending, and in which direction, and sends trading signals accordingly. A buy signal occurs when +DI line crosses above -DI line. A sell signal occurs when -DI line crosses below +DI line.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Indicators.DirectionalMovementSystem.ADX
member.summary: The Average Directional Movement Index (ADX) indicates whether the market is trending or ranging.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Indicators.DirectionalMovementSystem.DIPlus
member.summary: The Positive Direction Indicator (+DI) indicates upward trend movement.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Indicators.DirectionalMovementSystem.DIMinus
member.summary: The Negative Direction Indicator (-DI) indicates downward trend movement.

member.name: T:cAlgo.API.Indicators.DonchianChannel
member.summary: The Donchian channel is a volatility indicator forming a channel between the highest high and the lowest low of the chosen period.
member.remarks: The Donchian channel is mainly used for providing entry signals. A long is established when the price closes above the Donchian Channel. Conversely, if it closes below, then a short is established.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Indicators.DonchianChannel.Top
member.summary: Gets or sets the highest high of the period.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Indicators.DonchianChannel.Middle
member.summary: Gets or sets the middle of the highest high and the lowest low of the period.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Indicators.DonchianChannel.Bottom
member.summary: Gets or sets the lowest low of the period.

member.name: T:cAlgo.API.Indicators.EaseOfMovement
member.summary: Ease of Movement is a volume based oscillator that measures the "ease" of price movement.
member.remarks: It quantifies the price/volume relationship. When the oscillator is close to zero it signifies that prices will not move easy. Conversely, prices are advancing or declining with relative ease when the oscillator is positive or negative away from zero.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Indicators.EaseOfMovement.Result
member.summary: The time series of the Ease Of Movement Indicator.

member.name: T:cAlgo.API.Indicators.ExponentialMovingAverage
member.summary: The exponential moving average of the price data source over a period of time.
member.remarks: The exponential moving average is similar to the simple moving average, but applies more weight to more recent data. The weighting for each older price data decreases exponentially. Therefore the exponential moving average reacts faster to latest price changes than the simple moving average.

member.name: T:cAlgo.API.Indicators.FractalChaosBands
member.summary: The Fractal Chaos Bands indicator attempts to determine whether or not the market is trending.
member.remarks: When the market is trending, the bands will have a slope, and if the market is not trending or choppy, the bands will flatten out. The flatter the bands, the stronger the signal that the market is choppy. The more steep the band slopes, the stronger the signal that the market trending or stable.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Indicators.FractalChaosBands.High
member.summary: The high limit of the chaos band.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Indicators.FractalChaosBands.Low
member.summary: The low limit of the chaos band.

member.remarks: Ichimoku is a moving average based trend identification system. It contains more data points than standard candlestick charts and thus provides a clearer picture of potential price action.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Indicators.IchimokuKinkoHyo.SenkouSpanB

example.code: Print("SenkouSpanB Value = {0}", ichimokuKinkoHyo.SenkouSpanB.LastValue);

member.name: T:cAlgo.API.Indicators.ParabolicSAR
member.summary: The calculation of the Parabolic SAR Indicator.
member.remarks:
Developed by Welles Wilder, SAR stands for stop and reverse and is based on a concept similar to time decay, unless a security can continue to generate more profits over time, it should be liquidated.
SAR trails prices as the trend extends over time, being below prices when they are increasing and above prices when they are decreasing. In this view, the indicator stops and reverses when the price trend reverses and breaks above or below the indicator. The indicator generally works well in trending markets, but not during non-trending, sideways phases. Therefore, Wilder recommended establishing the strength and direction of the trend first through the use of other indicators and then using the Parabolic SAR to trade that trend.The indicator is below prices when prices are rising and above prices when prices are falling. In this regard, the indicator stops and reverses when the price trend reverses and breaks above or below the indicator.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Indicators.ParabolicSAR.Result
member.summary: Gets the resulting series of the Parabolic SAR indicator.

member.name: T:cAlgo.API.Indicators.RelativeStrengthIndex
member.summary: The RSI (Wilder) is momentum oscillator, measuring the velocity and magnitude of directional price movements.
member.remarks: The RSI is most typically used on a 14 day timeframe, measured on a scale from 0 to 100, with high and low levels marked at 70 and 30, respectively. Shorter or longer timeframes are used for alternately shorter or longer outlooks. More extreme high and low levelsï¿½80 and 20, or 90 and 10ï¿½occur less frequently but indicate stronger momentum.

member.name: T:cAlgo.API.Indicators.SimpleMovingAverage
member.summary: The simple moving average is an average of price within n previous periods.
member.remarks: The simple moving average is the unweighted mean of the previous n price data, where n is the period used for the calculation and price data the price data source, e.g. The closing price.

member.name: T:cAlgo.API.Indicators.StochasticOscillator
member.summary: The Stochastic Oscillator is a momentum indicator that aims to show price reversals by comparing the closing price to the price range.
member.remarks: Calculates the range between the high and low price during a given period of time. The current price is then expressed as a percentage of this range with 0% indicating the bottom of the range and 100% indicating the top of the range over this time period. Based on the theory that prices tend to close near the boundaries of the recent range.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Indicators.StochasticOscillator.PercentD
member.summary: %D is 3 Period Exponential Moving Average of %K.

example.code: double result = _stochastic.PercentK[index];

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Indicators.StochasticOscillator.PercentK
member.summary: Calculation of %K is 100 multiplied by the ratio of the closing price minus the lowest price over the last N periods over the highest price over the last N minus the lowest price over the last N periods.

example.code: double result = _stochastic.PercentD[index];

member.summary: Gets the resulting time series of the Williams Accumulation Distribution indicator calculation.

member.name: T:cAlgo.API.Indicators.WilliamsPctR
member.summary: Williams %R is an effective momentum oscillator and was described by Larry Williams for the first time in 1973.
member.remarks: It shows the relationship of the close relative to the high-low range over a set period of time.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Indicators.WilliamsPctR.Result
member.summary: Gets the resulting time series of the Williams PctR indicator calculation.

member.name: M:cAlgo.API.Internals.Algo.RefreshData
member.summary: Updates MarketSeries, Positions, PendingOrders, History, etc. And sends postponed events after Thread sleep call. If you put the main thread on sleep by calling Thread sleep method then you have to call RefreshData after Thread wakes up to send the postponed events while thread was sleeping.

member.name: T:cAlgo.API.Internals.IAccount
member.summary: Contains the current account information.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Internals.IAccount.AccountType
member.summary: Returns the current account type.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Internals.IAccount.Balance
member.summary: Returns the balance of the current account.

example.code: if ( Account.Balance < 0 ) Stop();

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Internals.IAccount.Equity
member.summary: Represents the equity of the current account (balance minus Unrealized Net Loss plus Unrealized Net Profit plus Bonus).

example.code: Print("The equity of this account is: {0}", Account.Equity);

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Internals.IAccount.Margin
member.summary: Represents the margin of the current account.

example.code: Print("The margin of this account is: {0}", Account.Margin);

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Internals.IAccount.FreeMargin
member.summary: Represents the free margin of the current account.

example.code: Print("The free margin of this account is: {0}", Account.FreeMargin);

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Internals.IAccount.MarginLevel
member.summary: Represents the margin level of the current account. Margin Level (in %) is calculated using this formula: Equity / Margin * 100

example.code: Print("The marginlevel of this account is: {0}", Account.MarginLevel);

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Internals.IAccount.IsLive
member.summary: Defines if the account is Live or Demo. True if the Account is Live, False if it is a Demo.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Internals.IAccount.Number
member.summary: Returns the number of the current account, e.g. 123456.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Internals.IAccount.BrokerName
member.summary: Returns the broker name of the current account.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Internals.IAccount.UnrealizedGrossProfit
member.summary: Gets the Unrealized Gross profit value.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Internals.IAccount.UnrealizedNetProfit
member.summary: Gets the Unrealized Net profit value.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Internals.IAccount.PreciseLeverage
member.summary: Gets the precise account leverage value.

example.code: var leverage = Account.Leverage;

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Internals.IAccount.StopOutLevel
member.summary: Stop Out level is a lowest allowed Margin Level for account. If Margin Level is less than Stop Out, position will be closed sequentially until Margin Level is greater than Stop Out.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Internals.IAccount.UserId
member.summary: Gets the user ID.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Internals.IAccount.Asset
member.summary: Gets the account deposit asset/currency

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Internals.IAccount.TotalMarginCalculationType
member.summary: Type of total margin requirements per Symbol.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Internals.IAccount.Credit
member.summary: Gets the credit of the current account.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Internals.IAccount.UserNickName
member.summary: Gets the user nick name.

member.name: E:cAlgo.API.Internals.IAccount.Switched
member.summary: Occurs when user switch his account.

member.name: M:cAlgo.API.Internals.IIndicatorsAccessor.AverageTrueRange(System.Int32,cAlgo.API.MovingAverageType)
member.summary: Average true range. An indicator providing the degree of price volatility.
member.remarks: Average true range (ATR) is a technical analysis volatility indicator originally developed by J. Welles Wilder. The indicator provides the degree of price volatility. The average true range is an N-day exponential moving average of the true range values. Wilder recommended a 14-period smoothing.
member.param: Period of moving average to use for Average True Range caluclation.
Type of moving average to use for Average True Range caluclation.

signature.code: public AverageTrueRange AverageTrueRange(int periods, MovingAverageType maType)

member.name: M:cAlgo.API.Internals.IIndicatorsAccessor.DonchianChannel(System.Int32)
member.summary: The Donchian channel is a volatility indicator forming a channel between the highest high and the lowest low of the chosen period.
member.remarks: The Donchian channel is mainly used for providing entry signals. A long is established when the price closes above the Donchian Channel. Conversely, if it closes below, then a short is established.
member.param: Period of Calculation of the Dochian Channel

Period of Calculation of the Dochian Channel

signature.code: public DonchianChannel DonchianChannel(Bars bars, int periods)

member.summary: Legendary trader Bill Williams, an early pioneer of market psychology, developed the trend-following Alligator indicator, which follows the premise that financial markets and individual securities trend just 15% to 30% of the time while grinding through sideways ranges the other 70% to 85% of the time.

example.code: Notifications.PlaySound(@"C:\SampleDestination\SampleSound.mp3");

member.name: M:cAlgo.API.Internals.INotifications.PlaySound(cAlgo.API.SoundType)
member.summary: Plays the specified SoundType.
member.remarks: This method doesn't work during backtesting and optimization. In indicators, use it with IsRealTime/IsLastBar, for real-time values.

example.code: Notifications.PlaySound(SoundType.PositiveNotification);

member.remarks: This method doesn't work during backtesting and optimization. Use correct settings before trying to send an email notification. You can do that in Preferences -> Email Settings

member.summary: Calculates the volume to be risked (in X units of the account deposit currency) based on the specified stop loss. Note that the result of this calculation may be imprecise as the exact degree of risk always depends on market movement and is impossible to predict.
member.param: The amount you want to risk in your account deposit currency.

signature.code: public double VolumeForFixedRisk(double amount, double stopLossInPips)

member.name: M:cAlgo.API.Internals.Symbol.VolumeForFixedRisk(System.Double,System.Double,cAlgo.API.RoundingMode)
member.summary: Calculates the volume to be risked (in X units of the account deposit currency) based on the specified stop loss. Note that the result of this calculation may be imprecise as the exact degree of risk always depends on market movement and is impossible to predict.
member.param: The amount you want to risk in your account deposit currency.

signature.code: public double VolumeForFixedRisk(double amount, double stopLossInPips, RoundingMode roundingMode)

member.name: M:cAlgo.API.Internals.Symbol.VolumeForProportionalRisk(cAlgo.API.ProportionalAmountType,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculates the volume to be risked (in X% of either the account equity or balance) based on the specified stop loss. Note that the result of this calculation may be imprecise as the exact degree of risk always depends on market movement and is impossible to predict.
member.param: The type of the amount to be risked (either balance or equity).
The percentage of equity or balance to be risked.

signature.code: public double VolumeForProportionalRisk(ProportionalAmountType type, double percentage, double stopLossInPips)

member.name: M:cAlgo.API.Internals.Symbol.VolumeForProportionalRisk(cAlgo.API.ProportionalAmountType,System.Double,System.Double,cAlgo.API.RoundingMode)
member.summary: Calculates the volume to be risked (in X% of either the account equity or balance) based on the specified stop loss. Note that the result of this calculation may be imprecise as the exact degree of risk always depends on market movement and is impossible to predict.
member.param: The type of the amount to be risked (either balance or equity).
The percentage of equity or balance to be risked.

signature.code: public double VolumeForProportionalRisk(ProportionalAmountType type, double percentage, double stopLossInPips, RoundingMode roundingMode)

member.name: M:cAlgo.API.Internals.Symbol.AmountRisked(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculates the amount to be risked based on the specified stop loss and trading volume. Note that the result of this calculation may be imprecise as the exact degree of risk always depends on market movement and is impossible to predict.

signature.code: public double AmountRisked(double volume, double stopLossInPips)

member.name: M:cAlgo.API.Internals.Symbol.PipsForFixedRisk(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculates the number of pips to be risked based on the specified stop loss and trading volume. Note that the result of this calculation may be imprecise as the exact degree of risk always depends on market movement and is impossible to predict.

signature.code: public double PipsForFixedRisk(double amount, double volume)

member.name: M:cAlgo.API.Internals.Symbol.PipsForProportionalRisk(cAlgo.API.ProportionalAmountType,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculates the stop loss (in pips) for the proportional amount to be risked based on the specified volume. Note that the result of this calculation may be imprecise as the exact degree of risk always depends on market movement and is impossible to predict.
member.param: The type of the amount to be risked (either balance or equity).
The percentage of equity or balance to be risked.
member.returns: The calculated stop loss in pips.

signature.code: public double PipsForProportionalRisk(ProportionalAmountType type, double percentage, double volume)

member.name: T:cAlgo.API.Internals.TotalMarginCalculationType
member.summary: Defines types of total margin requirements per Symbol.

member.name: F:cAlgo.API.Internals.TotalMarginCalculationType.Sum
member.summary: Total margin requirements per Symbol are equal to Sum of all margin requirements of all positions of that Symbol.

member.name: F:cAlgo.API.Internals.TotalMarginCalculationType.Max
member.summary: Total margin requirements per Symbol are equal to Max margin requirements from all Long and all Short Positions of that Symbol.

member.name: F:cAlgo.API.Internals.TotalMarginCalculationType.Net
member.summary: Total margin requirements per Symbol are equal to the difference between margin requirements of all Long and all Short Positions of that Symbol.

member.name: M:cAlgo.API.LocalStorage.GetString(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a string value from local storage. This method will search all available scopes (Instance -> Type -> Device) and stops on first found value.
member.param: The key of the element to get, max length for keys is 50 characters, and only alphanumeric and space characters are allowed, you can only use space in the middle of key not at the start or end
member.returns: The requested value or an empty string if the provided key is not found

member.name: M:cAlgo.API.LocalStorage.GetString(System.String,cAlgo.API.LocalStorageScope)
member.summary: Gets a string value from local storage.
member.param: The key of the element to get, max length for keys is 50 characters, and only alphanumeric and space characters are allowed, you can only use space in the middle of key not at the start or end
The storage scope of the element
member.returns: The requested value or an empty string if the provided key is not found

signature.code: public string GetString(string key, LocalStorageScope localStorageScope)

member.name: M:cAlgo.API.LocalStorage.GetObject``1(System.String)
member.summary: Gets an object from local storage. This method will search all available scopes (Instance -> Type -> Device) and stops on first found value.
member.param: The key of the element to get, max length for keys is 50 characters, and only alphanumeric and space characters are allowed, you can only use space in the middle of key not at the start or end
member.returns: The deserialized object or default value of type if the provided key is not found or the object cannot be deserialized

member.name: M:cAlgo.API.LocalStorage.GetObject``1(System.String,cAlgo.API.LocalStorageScope)
member.summary: Gets an object from local storage.

The storage scope of the element
member.returns: The deserialized object or default value of type if the provided key is not found or the object cannot be deserialized

signature.code: public T GetObject(string key, LocalStorageScope localStorageScope)

member.name: M:cAlgo.API.LocalStorage.Flush(cAlgo.API.LocalStorageScope)
member.summary: Saves all data to the disk. When using local storage, data is automatically saved every minute. Use this method if you want to save data without delays.
member.param: The storage scope to save to disk

member.name: M:cAlgo.API.LocalStorage.Reload(cAlgo.API.LocalStorageScope)
member.summary: Reloads all values from the disk. When calling this method, unsaved pending changes may be lost. To avoid losing information, call the Flush() method first.

member.name: T:cAlgo.API.LocalStorageScope
member.summary: Defines the local storage scope.

member.name: F:cAlgo.API.LocalStorageScope.Instance
member.summary: The value is stored and can be accessed only by a specific running instance of a cBot/Indicator.

member.name: F:cAlgo.API.LocalStorageScope.Type
member.summary: The value is stored and can be accessed by all running instances of one or more cBot(s)/Indicator(s).

member.name: F:cAlgo.API.LocalStorageScope.Device
member.summary: The value is stored and can be accessed by all running instances of a cBots/Indicators on this device.

member.summary: A stop order is an order to buy or sell once the price of the symbol reaches a specified price.

member.name: F:cAlgo.API.PendingOrderType.StopLimit
member.summary: A stop limit order is an order to buy or sell once the price of the symbol reaches specific price. Order has a parameter for maximum distance from that target price, where it can be executed.

member.name: M:cAlgo.API.Plugin.RefreshData
member.summary: Updates MarketSeries, Positions, PendingOrders, History, etc. And sends postponed events after Thread sleep call. If you put the main thread on sleep by calling Thread sleep method then you have to call RefreshData after Thread wakes up to send the postponed events while thread was sleeping.

member.name: T:cAlgo.API.Position
member.summary: Taking or opening a position means buying or selling a trading pair.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Position.SymbolName
member.summary: Gets the symbol name.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Position.TradeType
member.summary: Trade type (Buy/Sell) of the position.

example.code: ExecuteMarketOrder(TradeType.Buy, Symbol, 10000, "myLabel", 10,10); Print(LastResult.Position.TradeType);

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Position.VolumeInUnits
member.summary: The amount traded by the position.

example.code: ExecuteMarketOrder(TradeType.Buy, Symbol, 10000, "myLabel", 10,10); Print(LastResult.Position.VolumeInUnits);

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Position.Id
member.summary: The position's unique identifier.

example.code: ExecuteMarketOrder(TradeType.Buy, Symbol, 10000, "myLabel", 10,10); Print(LastResult.Position.Id);

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Position.GrossProfit
member.summary: Gross profit accrued by the order associated with the position.

example.code: ExecuteMarketOrder(TradeType.Buy, Symbol, 10000, "myLabel", 10,10); Print(LastResult.Position.GrossProfit);

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Position.EntryPrice
member.summary: Entry price of the position.

example.code: ExecuteMarketOrder(TradeType.Buy, Symbol, 10000, "myLabel", 10,10); Print(LastResult.Position.EntryPrice);

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Position.StopLoss
member.summary: The Stop Loss level of the position.

example.code: ExecuteMarketOrder(TradeType.Buy, Symbol, 10000, "myLabel", 10,10); Print(LastResult.Position.StopLoss);

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Position.TakeProfit
member.summary: The take profit level of the position.

example.code: ExecuteMarketOrder(TradeType.Buy, Symbol, 10000, "myLabel", 10,10); Print(LastResult.Position.TakeProfit);

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Position.NetProfit
member.summary: The Net profit of the position.

example.code: ExecuteMarketOrder(TradeType.Buy, Symbol, 10000, "myLabel", 10,10); Print(LastResult.Position.NetProfit);

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Position.Swap
member.summary: Swap is the overnight interest rate if any, accrued on the position.

example.code: Print(LastResult.Position.Swap);

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Position.Commissions
member.summary: Commission Amount of the request to trade one way (Buy/Sell) associated with this position.

example.code: ExecuteMarketOrder(TradeType.Buy, Symbol, 10000, "myLabel", 10,10); Print(LastResult.Position.Commissions);

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Position.EntryTime
member.summary: Entry time of trade associated with the position. The Timezone used is set in the cBot attribute.

example.code: ExecuteMarketOrder(TradeType.Buy, Symbol, 10000, "myLabel", 10,10); Print(LastResult.Position.EntryTime);

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Position.Pips
member.summary: Represents the winning or loosing pips of the position.

example.code: ExecuteMarketOrder(TradeType.Buy, Symbol, 10000, "myLabel", 10,10); Print(LastResult.Position.Pips);

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Position.Label
member.summary: Label can be used to represent the order.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Position.Comment
member.summary: Comment can be used as a note for the order.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Position.Quantity
member.summary: Quantity of lots traded by the position.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Position.HasTrailingStop
member.summary: When HasTrailingStop set to true, the server updates the Stop Loss every time the position moves in your favor.

example.code: ExecuteMarketOrder(TradeType.Buy, Symbol, 10000, "myLabel", 10, 10, 2, "comment", true); Print("Position was opened, has Trailing Stop = {0}", result.Position.HasTrailingStop);

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Position.StopLossTriggerMethod
member.summary: Trigger method for the position's Stop Loss.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Position.Margin
member.summary: The amount of used margin by the position.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Position.CurrentPrice
member.summary: Gets the position current market price. If Position's TradeType is Buy it returns Symbol current Bid price. If position's TradeType is Sell it returns Symbol current Ask price.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Position.Symbol
member.summary: Gets the position symbol.

member.name: T:cAlgo.API.Positions
member.summary: Provides access to methods of the positions collection.

example.code: int totalPositions = Positions.Count;
Position position = Positions.Find("myLabel", Symbol, TradeType.Buy);
Position[] positions = Positions.FindAll("myLabel", Symbol, TradeType.Buy);
Positions.Opened += PositionsOnOpened;

member.summary: Finds a position by index.

example.code: var position = Positions[0];

member.summary: The total number of open positions.

example.code: int totalPositions = Positions.Count;

member.returns: Position if it exists, null otherwise

example.code: var position = Positions.Find("myLabel");

member.name: T:cAlgo.API.Robot
member.summary: Base class for all cBots.
member.remarks: Provides a convenient framework for creating cBots including methods to create, modify, cancel orders and close positions, methods triggered by each tick and each bar, access to built-in Indicators and more.

member.name: M:cAlgo.API.Robot.#ctor
member.summary: Robot class constructor

member.name: M:cAlgo.API.Robot.OnStart
member.summary: Called when cBot is being started. Override this method to initialize cBot, create nested indicators, etc.

member.name: M:cAlgo.API.Robot.OnStop
member.summary: Called when cBot is stopped.

member.name: M:cAlgo.API.Robot.OnTick
member.summary: Called on each incoming market tick.

member.name: M:cAlgo.API.Robot.OnBar
member.summary: Called on each incoming Bar.

member.name: M:cAlgo.API.Robot.OnBarClosed
member.summary: Called when a new bar is opened; the method is called for the previous (closed) bar.

member.name: M:cAlgo.API.Robot.OnError(cAlgo.API.Error)
member.summary: Called if there is an error executing a trade operation.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Robot.Account
member.summary: Contains all Account information

member.name: M:cAlgo.API.Robot.Stop
member.summary: Stops the cBot. cBot will be completely stopped and will not send/receive any signals.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.Robot.LastResult
member.summary: The latest trade result

member.name: M:cAlgo.API.Robot.ToString
member.summary: Returns the cBot class name

member.name: M:cAlgo.API.Robot.GetFitness(cAlgo.API.GetFitnessArgs)
member.summary: Override this method to provide custom fitness value for Optimization

member.summary: Execute a Market Order
member.param: Base price to calculate relative slippage price

example.code: ExecuteMarketRangeOrder(TradeType.Sell, Symbol, 10000);

ExecuteMarketRangeOrder(TradeType.Buy, Symbol, 10000, "myLabel", 10, 10);
ExecuteMarketRangeOrder(TradeType.Sell, Symbol, 10000, "Robot1", 10, 10, 2);
ExecuteMarketRangeOrder(TradeType.Buy, Symbol, 5000, "myRobot", StopLoss, TakeProfit, Slippage, "this is a comment");

PlaceStopOrder(TradeType.Sell, Symbol, 20000, Symbol.Ask, "myStopOrder", 20, 20, null, "my comment");

member.name: T:cAlgo.API.RoundingMode
member.summary: The rounding mode for normalizing trade volume.

example.code: volume = Symbol.NormalizeVolume(volume, RoundingMode.Down);

member.name: F:cAlgo.API.RoundingMode.ToNearest
member.summary: Round value to the nearest tradable volume.

example.code: var volume = Symbol.NormalizeVolume(calculatedVolume, RoundingMode.ToNearest);

member.name: F:cAlgo.API.RoundingMode.Down
member.summary: Round value down to tradable volume.

example.code: var volume = Symbol.NormalizeVolume(calculatedVolume, RoundingMode.Down);

member.name: F:cAlgo.API.RoundingMode.Up
member.summary: Round value up to tradable volume.

example.code: var volume = Symbol.NormalizeVolume(calculatedVolume, RoundingMode.Up);

member.summary: Gets the symbol base commission calculation type.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.SymbolInfo.MinCommission
member.summary: Gets the minimum amount of commission for the symbol. This is the amount of commission that will be paid by trader for any trade. Check MinCommissionType for interpretation of MinCommission value.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.SymbolInfo.MinCommissionAsset
member.summary: Gets the symbol minimum commission asset. If MinCommissionType is set to Asset then you can use this property to get that asset. The MinCommission value will be converted from MinCommissionAsset to account deposit asset at the moment of trade.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.SymbolInfo.MinCommissionType
member.summary: Gets the symbol minimum commission type. Use this property to interpret MinCommission value.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.SymbolInfo.AdministrativeCharge3DaysRollover
member.summary: Gets the Day of the week (in UTC) when Administrative Fee charge amount will be tripled. Only applicable for SWAP free trading accounts.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.SymbolInfo.AdministrativeCharge
member.summary: Gets symbol administrative charge. Administrative fee will be charged instead of SWAP if account is marked as SWAP free. Only applicable for SWAP free trading accounts.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.SymbolInfo.GracePeriod
member.summary: Gets symbol grace period. This is the number of days free of Administrative fee from the time of opening a position. Only applicable for SWAP free trading accounts.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.SymbolInfo.SwapLong
member.summary: Gets the SWAP charge for long positions of the symbol.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.SymbolInfo.SwapShort
member.summary: Gets the SWAP charge for short positions of the symbol.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.SymbolInfo.Swap3DaysRollover
member.summary: Gets the Day of the week when Symbol SWAP charge amount will be tripled.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.SymbolInfo.SwapCalculationType
member.summary: Gets the symbol SWAP calculation type.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.SymbolInfo.IsTradingEnabled
member.summary: Gets If trading is enabled or not for the symbol.

member.summary: Gets symbol trading mode.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.SymbolInfo.MinDistanceType
member.summary: Gets the symbol minimum distances type.

member.summary: Gets symbol minimum take profit distance. Use MinDistanceType for interpretation.

member.name: M:cAlgo.API.SymbolInfo.GetEstimatedMargin(cAlgo.API.TradeType,System.Double)
member.summary: Returns the amount of margin you need for x amount of volume.

member.name: M:cAlgo.API.SymbolInfo.VolumeForFixedRisk(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculates the volume to be risked (in X units of the account deposit currency) based on the specified stop loss. Note that the result of this calculation may be imprecise as the exact degree of risk always depends on market movement and is impossible to predict.
member.param: The amount you want to risk in your account deposit currency.

member.name: M:cAlgo.API.SymbolInfo.VolumeForFixedRisk(System.Double,System.Double,cAlgo.API.RoundingMode)
member.summary: Calculates the volume to be risked (in X units of the account deposit currency) based on the specified stop loss. Note that the result of this calculation may be imprecise as the exact degree of risk always depends on market movement and is impossible to predict.
member.param: The amount you want to risk in your account deposit currency.

member.name: M:cAlgo.API.SymbolInfo.VolumeForProportionalRisk(cAlgo.API.ProportionalAmountType,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculates the volume to be risked (in X% of either the account equity or balance) based on the specified stop loss. Note that the result of this calculation may be imprecise as the exact degree of risk always depends on market movement and is impossible to predict.
member.param: The type of the amount to be risked (either balance or equity).
The percentage of equity or balance to be risked.

member.name: M:cAlgo.API.SymbolInfo.VolumeForProportionalRisk(cAlgo.API.ProportionalAmountType,System.Double,System.Double,cAlgo.API.RoundingMode)
member.summary: Calculates the volume to be risked (in X% of either the account equity or balance) based on the specified stop loss. Note that the result of this calculation may be imprecise as the exact degree of risk always depends on market movement and is impossible to predict.
member.param: The type of the amount to be risked (either balance or equity).
The percentage of equity or balance to be risked.

member.name: M:cAlgo.API.SymbolInfo.AmountRisked(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculates the amount to be risked based on the specified stop loss and trading volume. Note that the result of this calculation may be imprecise as the exact degree of risk always depends on market movement and is impossible to predict.

member.name: M:cAlgo.API.SymbolInfo.PipsForFixedRisk(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculates the number of pips to be risked based on the specified stop loss and trading volume. Note that the result of this calculation may be imprecise as the exact degree of risk always depends on market movement and is impossible to predict.

member.name: M:cAlgo.API.SymbolInfo.PipsForProportionalRisk(cAlgo.API.ProportionalAmountType,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculates the stop loss (in pips) for the proportional amount to be risked based on the specified volume. Note that the result of this calculation may be imprecise as the exact degree of risk always depends on market movement and is impossible to predict.
member.param: The type of the amount to be risked (either balance or equity).
The percentage of equity or balance to be risked.
member.returns: The calculated stop loss in pips.

member.name: T:cAlgo.API.TradeType
member.summary: The direction of a trade order.
member.remarks: Indicates the trade direction, whether it is a Buy or a Sell trade.

example.code: ExecuteMarketOrder(TradeType.Buy, Symbol, 20000);
Position position = Positions.Find("myLabel", Symbol, TradeType.Sell);
PlaceLimitOrder(TradeType.Buy, Symbol, 10000, Symbol.Bid);

member.name: F:cAlgo.API.TradeType.Buy
member.summary: Represents a Buy order.

example.code: ExecuteMarketOrder(TradeType.Buy, Symbol, 10000);
var result = PlaceLimitOrder(TradeType.Buy, Symbol, 10000, Symbol.Bid);

member.name: F:cAlgo.API.TradeType.Sell
member.summary: Represents a Sell order.

example.code: ExecuteMarketOrder(TradeType.Sell, Symbol, 10000);
var result = PlaceLimitOrder(TradeType.Sell, Symbol, 10000, Symbol.Ask);

member.name: T:cAlgo.API.StopTriggerMethod
member.summary: The trigger side for the Stop Orders.

member.name: F:cAlgo.API.StopTriggerMethod.Trade
member.summary: Trade method uses default trigger behavior for Stop orders. Buy order and Stop Loss for Sell position will be triggered when Ask >= order price. Sell order and Stop Loss for Buy position will be triggered when Bid <= order price.

member.name: F:cAlgo.API.StopTriggerMethod.Opposite
member.summary: Opposite method uses opposite price for order triggering. Buy order and Stop Loss for Sell position will be triggered when Bid >= order price. Sell order and Stop Loss for Buy position will be triggered when Ask <= order price.

member.name: F:cAlgo.API.StopTriggerMethod.DoubleTrade
member.summary: Uses default prices for order triggering, but waits for additional confirmation - two consecutive prices should meet criteria to trigger order. Buy order and Stop Loss for Sell position will be triggered when two consecutive Ask prices >= order price. Sell order and Stop Loss for Buy position will be triggered when two consecutive Bid prices <= order price.

member.name: F:cAlgo.API.StopTriggerMethod.DoubleOpposite
member.summary: Uses opposite prices for order triggering, and waits for additional confirmation - two consecutive prices should meet criteria to trigger order. Buy order and Stop Loss for Sell position will be triggered when two consecutive Bid prices >= order price. Sell order and Stop Loss for Buy position will be triggered when two consecutive Ask prices <= order price.

member.name: T:cAlgo.API.WebSocketClientCloseStatus
member.summary: An enumeration of different Web socket client close states / reasons.

member.name: F:cAlgo.API.WebSocketClientCloseStatus.Empty
member.summary: No error specified.

member.name: F:cAlgo.API.WebSocketClientCloseStatus.EndpointUnavailable
member.summary: (1001) Indicates an endpoint is being removed. Either the server or client will become unavailable.

member.name: F:cAlgo.API.WebSocketClientCloseStatus.InternalServerError
member.summary: (1011) The connection will be closed by the server because of an error on the server.

member.name: F:cAlgo.API.WebSocketClientCloseStatus.InvalidMessageType
member.summary: (1003) The client or server is terminating the connection because it cannot accept the data type it received.

member.name: F:cAlgo.API.WebSocketClientCloseStatus.InvalidPayloadData
member.summary: (1007) The client or server is terminating the connection because it has received data inconsistent with the message type.

member.name: F:cAlgo.API.WebSocketClientCloseStatus.MandatoryExtension
member.summary: (1010) The client is terminating the connection because it expected the server to negotiate an extension.

member.name: F:cAlgo.API.WebSocketClientCloseStatus.MessageTooBig
member.summary: (1009) The client or server is terminating the connection because it has received a message that is too big for it to process.

member.name: F:cAlgo.API.WebSocketClientCloseStatus.NormalClosure
member.summary: (1000) The connection has closed after the request was fulfilled.

member.name: F:cAlgo.API.WebSocketClientCloseStatus.PolicyViolation
member.summary: (1008) The connection will be closed because an endpoint has received a message that violates its policy.

member.name: F:cAlgo.API.WebSocketClientCloseStatus.ProtocolError
member.summary: (1008) The client or server is terminating the connection because of a protocol error.

member.name: T:cAlgo.API.WebSocketClientOptions
member.summary: Websocket client options.

member.summary: Creates WebSocketClientOptions with default values.

member.summary: Gets or sets the operation timeout. Default value is set to 60 seconds.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.WebSocketClientOptions.SubProtocols
member.summary: Gets or sets sub-protocols to be negotiated during the WebSocket connection handshake.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.WebSocketClientOptions.KeepAliveInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the WebSocket protocol keep-alive interval. Default value is set to 30 seconds.

member.name: P:cAlgo.API.WebSocketClientOptions.UseDefaultCredentials
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean value that indicates if default credentials should be used during WebSocket handshake. Default value is false.

member.name: T:cAlgo.API.WebSocketClientState
member.summary: An enumeration of different Web socket client states.

member.name: F:cAlgo.API.WebSocketClientState.None
member.summary: Reserved for future use.

member.name: F:cAlgo.API.WebSocketClientState.Connecting
member.summary: The connection is negotiating the handshake with the remote endpoint.

member.name: F:cAlgo.API.WebSocketClientState.Open
member.summary: The initial state after the HTTP handshake has been completed.

member.name: F:cAlgo.API.WebSocketClientState.CloseSent
member.summary: A close message was sent to the remote endpoint.

member.name: F:cAlgo.API.WebSocketClientState.CloseReceived
member.summary: A close message was received from the remote endpoint.

member.name: F:cAlgo.API.WebSocketClientState.Closed
member.summary: Indicates the WebSocket close handshake completed gracefully.

member.name: F:cAlgo.API.WebSocketClientState.Aborted
member.summary: Indicates that the WebSocket has been aborted.
